website_summaries.verdict: Who needs cash when you can push your power level over 9,000? A race to be the strongest is a fun remix on the formula, and it perfectly fits the Dragon Ball theme.
pros: The classic Monopoly game, with a Dragon Ball Z twist
6 pewter Dragon Ball player tokens, like Trunk’s Sword and a Dragon Ball
Collect fighters to become the strongest
cons: A fairly expensive version of Monopoly

customer_reviews.title: Was kinda iffy about this purchase but I’m glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Was kinda iffy about this purchase but I’m glad I did. Die hard DBZ fans. Bought for my son, he was SO HAPPY. This is same quality as all monopoly games, very thick board. The player pieces are heavy and feel like they are actual quality all except Gohans sword it’s lighter than the rest. Again, have no complaints. Nice board game!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Characters only go up to the Cell Saga, but love it. We’ve had the regular Monopoly for years. Got this and been playing it very often. People who were never fans of DragonBall Z love playing this one more than the regular one just because of the added characters. Only bad thing is the quality of the metal player pieces. They are horrendous.
customer_reviews.author: A. Faruk

customer_reviews.title: Ka..Me..Ha..Me..Hoooours of fun!! Lol
customer_reviews.text: My fiancee & I are big kids, we love Dragon Ball & board games, so this was perfect! We also wanted something to keep us occupied if another hurricane comes through & knocks the power out again lol. We played for hours! Everything being themed was awesome, I've never had a themed monopoly game before. The Chance & Community Chest cards are themed the pieces, the game board! If you love DBZ you'll love this game!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Tragedi Merlot

customer_reviews.title: But fun to play otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Not enough game peices to upgrade multiple properties with houses or hotels. And light on the money. But fun to play otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the spelling
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been slowly over the years collect all the special edition monopoly versions. I was so quick to order this one that I didn’t realize the spelling was wrong and I got nervous that maybe I would get a messed up edition. Haven’t opened it but everything down to the packaging looks good and it’s just gonna sit with the others.
customer_reviews.author: Tinaxo11

customer_reviews.title: Dragon Ball Z Monopoly
customer_reviews.text: Dragon Ball Z is a great anime series. Have read several of the books, some trading cards and now a Monopoly game for it. How good is that? Love the Monopoly game, so eager to play this version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Husband is a huge DBZ fan so he loved this gift! Play just like regular Monopoly except the characters are bought instead of properties.

product_meta.title: MONOPOLY Dragon Ball Z Board Game | Recruit Legendary Warriors GOKU, VEGETA and GOHAN | Official Dragon Ball Z Anime Series Merchandise | Themed Monopoly Game
product_meta.description: Raise your power level! in this Episode of Dragon ball Z, we find the Z fighters in an epic battle of dice rolling and real estate! recruit legendary warriors like Goku, Vegeta and Gohan to help in this adventure of Monopoly: Dragon ball Z! take a chance to be the richest fighter in the world as you encounter the red ribbon army and the capsule Corp. Friends like Bulma and master Roshi can help you along the way on your path to greatness! can you collect all the deeds and be the greatest?
feature_bullets: Pick your favorite icon to carry you around the game board
Recruit your team to become the richest fighter
Upgrade your team with Kame houses and Hyperbolic Time Chambers
6 Collectible tokens: Trunk's Sword, DynoCap, 4-Star Dragon Ball, Dragon Radar, Saiyan Armor, Turtle Shell

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars334 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
